history.content:
As a grad class, you need to ask the professor for permission to register; that is the "career of study" that the message refers to.

Depending on the professor, you may be given the code directly, or you may have an entrance exam, or something else. (This is true for all grad classes in all departments.)

children.subject:
Hm, a number of Info classes used to have instructions on the department's website for how undergrads can enroll. I can't seem to find these in the new website this semester though.

Emailing sounds ideal.
Oh alright, so I should just email the professor then?

history.content:
I'm trying to get into an Info graduate class to satisfy some upper division technical units, but I receive this message:

Permission to enroll in this class is required. The class falls outside your career of study. Choose another class.

However, this class is counted as a technical class according to http://guide.berkeley.edu/undergraduate/degree-programs/computer-science/#majorrequirementstext.

Is there anything I can do? I'm unable to add myself to the waitlist either, even though it seems there are plenty of seats still available
history.subject: Enrolling into a Info Grad Class?
